text: James "Jim" Harrison (December 11, 1937 â€“ March 26, 2016) was an American author. He was known for his poetry, fiction, reviews, essays about the outdoors, and writings about food. He was best known for his 1979 novella Legends of the Fall. He has been called "a force of nature", and his work has been compared to that of William Faulkner and Ernest Hemingway. Harrison died of a heart attack on March 26, 2016, aged 78.https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2016/03/27/us/ap-us-obit-jim- harrison.html?_r=1 == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American poets Category:Writers from Michigan
title: Jim Harrison
